intro: Minuartia turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkestan sandwort, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to Central Asia. It typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and sandy areas. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Minuartia turcomanica is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its diverse and often delicate floral structures.
